message.content:
cs.AI, cs.SY, cs.LG, cs.MA, cs.RO 

The paper proposes a methodology that incorporates approaches from sequential decision making in artificial intelligence, including macro-action and multi-time scale abstractions, coupled with an underlying state-space approximation to reduce state-space and action-space size. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the cs.AI sub-category. The paper also deals with optimally operating a HVAC system, which involves control systems and optimization, indicating that it could belong to the cs.SY sub-category. The use of dynamic programming and state-space approximation suggests that the paper could also belong to the cs.LG sub-category. The paper proposes a novel methodology for reducing the computational burden of the DP algorithm, which could be relevant to the cs.MA sub-category. Finally, the paper deals with energy management in buildings, which could be relevant to the cs.RO sub-category.
